title: Hebrews Chapter 8 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Hebrews chapter 8 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Hebrews Chapter 8 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Hebrews Chapter 8.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 8:1, where is the high priest set?
options: On the right hand of the throne of the Majesty in the heavens
In the holy sanctuary on earth
At the entrance of the tabernacle
On the left hand of the throne of the Majesty in the heavens
questions.correctAnswer: On the right hand of the throne of the Majesty in the heavens
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:1 states that the high priest is set on the right hand of the throne of the Majesty in the heavens.

questions.question: What is the true tabernacle described as in Hebrews 8:2?
options: The one the Lord pitched, not man
The one Moses built on earth
The one made by the priests of Israel
A symbolic tent made by angels
questions.correctAnswer: The one the Lord pitched, not man
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:2 tells us the true tabernacle is the one the Lord pitched, not man.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 8:3, what is every high priest ordained to do?
options: Offer gifts and sacrifices
Build the tabernacle
Lead the people in worship
Interpret the law
questions.correctAnswer: Offer gifts and sacrifices
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:3 states that every high priest is ordained to offer gifts and sacrifices.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 8:4, why would the man not be a priest if he were on earth?
options: Because there are priests that offer gifts according to the law
Because he is not from the tribe of Levi
Because he did not build the tabernacle
Because he lacks the proper garments
questions.correctAnswer: Because there are priests that offer gifts according to the law
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:4 explains that if he were on earth, he should not be a priest since there are priests who offer gifts according to the law.

questions.question: What did God instruct Moses to do when making the tabernacle, according to Hebrews 8:5?
options: Make all things according to the pattern shown on the mount
Build a larger sanctuary than before
Create new laws for the people
Offer sacrifices on behalf of the people
questions.correctAnswer: Make all things according to the pattern shown on the mount
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:5 states Moses was admonished by God to make all things according to the pattern shown on the mount.

questions.question: Hebrews 8:6 describes the high priest as the mediator of what?
options: A better covenant
The old covenant
The covenant of works
A covenant with angels
questions.correctAnswer: A better covenant
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:6 says he is the mediator of a better covenant established on better promises.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 8:7, why was a second covenant needed?
options: Because the first covenant was not faultless
Because the people demanded it
Because the priests failed
Because the tabernacle was destroyed
questions.correctAnswer: Because the first covenant was not faultless
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:7 explains that if the first covenant had been faultless, no place would have been sought for the second.

questions.question: Who does the Lord say He will make a new covenant with in Hebrews 8:8?
options: The house of Israel and the house of Judah
The house of Egypt
The Gentiles
The priests and Levites
questions.correctAnswer: The house of Israel and the house of Judah
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:8 states the Lord will make a new covenant with the house of Israel and the house of Judah.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 8:9, why did God not regard the covenant He made with their fathers?
options: Because they continued not in His covenant
Because it was imperfectly written
Because the priests disobeyed
Because the tabernacle was destroyed
questions.correctAnswer: Because they continued not in His covenant
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:9 explains God did not regard the covenant because the people did not continue in it.

questions.question: True or False: Hebrews 8:10 says God will put His laws into their hearts and minds.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:10 states God will put His laws into their mind and write them in their hearts.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 8:11, who will know the Lord in the new covenant?
options: All, from the least to the greatest
Only the priests
Only the elders
Only the scribes
questions.correctAnswer: All, from the least to the greatest
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:11 says that all shall know the Lord, from the least to the greatest.

questions.question: What will God do regarding their sins and iniquities according to Hebrews 8:12?
options: He will remember them no more
He will punish them severely
He will record them in a book
He will forgive only some
questions.correctAnswer: He will remember them no more
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:12 says God will be merciful and remember their sins and iniquities no more.

questions.question: True or False: Hebrews 8:13 says that the new covenant makes the first old and ready to vanish away.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:13 states that by saying 'a new covenant,' the first is made old and ready to vanish away.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Hebrews 8:1: 'We have such an high priest, who is set on the ______ of the throne of the Majesty in the heavens.'
options: right hand
left hand
footstool
center
questions.correctAnswer: right hand
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:1 states the high priest is set on the right hand of the throne of the Majesty in the heavens.

questions.question: True or False: Hebrews 8:6 says the high priest obtained a less excellent ministry than before.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:6 says he obtained a more excellent ministry, not less.

medium.title: Hebrews Chapter 8 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Hebrews Chapter 8 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with doubt about God's promises. Based on Hebrews 8, what biblical truth would you share about the new covenant?
options: The new covenant is established on better promises
The old covenant is still the only valid agreement
God no longer makes covenants with people
The new covenant requires strict earthly sacrifices
questions.correctAnswer: The new covenant is established on better promises
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:6 explains that Jesus is mediator of a better covenant, which was established upon better promises. This reassures believers of God's faithful and superior commitment.

questions.question: How does Hebrews 8 teach us about forgiveness when dealing with someone who has repeatedly sinned against us?
options: God will be merciful and remember their sins no more
We should hold grudges to teach them a lesson
Forgiveness is only for minor offenses
We must wait until they fully repent before forgiving
questions.correctAnswer: God will be merciful and remember their sins no more
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:12 states God will be merciful to their unrighteousness and will remember their sins no more. This encourages believers to forgive as God forgives.

questions.question: A believer is confused about the role of Jesus as High Priest. What does Hebrews 8 teach about His priesthood?
options: He is a High Priest seated at the right hand of the Majesty in heaven
He is an earthly priest offering sacrifices daily
He was a temporary priest during the Old Testament
He only serves as a prophet, not a priest
questions.correctAnswer: He is a High Priest seated at the right hand of the Majesty in heaven
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:1 says Jesus is a High Priest set on the right hand of the throne of the Majesty in the heavens, indicating His eternal and divine priesthood.

questions.question: How does Hebrews 8 describe the tabernacle where Jesus ministers?
options: The true tabernacle which the Lord pitched, not man
A temporary earthly tabernacle built by Moses
A symbolic tent with no real significance
An earthly sanctuary made by skilled craftsmen
questions.correctAnswer: The true tabernacle which the Lord pitched, not man
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:2 explains Jesus ministers in the true tabernacle which God set up, unlike the earthly tabernacle made by human hands.

questions.question: A believer asks why the first covenant was replaced. What answer does Hebrews 8 offer about the first covenant's fault?
options: It had faults and required a better covenant
It was perfect and never replaced
It was replaced due to political reasons
It was only for a specific ethnic group
questions.correctAnswer: It had faults and required a better covenant
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:7 explains that if the first covenant had been faultless, there would be no need for a second. This highlights the imperfection of the old covenant.

questions.question: Based on Hebrews 8, how should Christians view God's laws under the new covenant?
options: God will put His laws into their minds and write them on their hearts
The laws are abolished and no longer needed
The laws are only for priests to follow
The laws remain external rules to obey
questions.correctAnswer: God will put His laws into their minds and write them on their hearts
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:10 teaches that God will internalize His laws in believers’ minds and hearts, encouraging obedience from within rather than external compulsion.

questions.question: A believer is discouraged about personal knowledge of God. What assurance does Hebrews 8 give concerning knowing the Lord?
options: All shall know the Lord, from the least to the greatest
Only religious leaders will know God intimately
Knowing God is only for the mature in faith
Knowledge of God is hidden and secret
questions.correctAnswer: All shall know the Lord, from the least to the greatest
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:11 assures that under the new covenant, everyone will know the Lord personally, removing barriers to knowing Him.

questions.question: How does Hebrews 8 describe the earthly priests in relation to the heavenly things?
options: They serve as an example and shadow of heavenly things
They have the full reality of the heavenly ministry
They are unnecessary under the new covenant
They are superior to Jesus’ priesthood
questions.correctAnswer: They serve as an example and shadow of heavenly things
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:5 explains that earthly priests and the tabernacle are shadows and examples of the true heavenly realities, pointing to Christ’s superior ministry.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 8, why is Jesus not a priest on earth?
options: Because there are earthly priests offering gifts according to the law
Because He was never ordained as a priest
Because He only served as a prophet on earth
Because priesthood ended with Moses
questions.correctAnswer: Because there are earthly priests offering gifts according to the law
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:4 states that if Jesus were on earth, He would not be a priest since there are priests who offer gifts according to the Mosaic law.

questions.question: How does Hebrews 8 encourage believers to respond to the impermanence of the old covenant?
options: By embracing the new covenant that is ready to replace the old
By clinging to the old covenant as the only true way
By rejecting all covenants as unreliable
By making a new covenant themselves
questions.correctAnswer: By embracing the new covenant that is ready to replace the old
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:13 reveals that the first covenant is becoming obsolete, encouraging believers to embrace the new and better covenant in Christ.

questions.question: What does Hebrews 8 teach about the mediator's role in the new covenant?
options: The mediator mediates a better covenant with better promises
The mediator only enforces the old covenant
The mediator acts as a judge to condemn sinners
The mediator is a human priest with limited power
questions.correctAnswer: The mediator mediates a better covenant with better promises
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:6 highlights that Jesus is the mediator of a better covenant founded on better promises, offering hope and assurance to believers.

questions.question: A believer wonders how the new covenant affects their relationship with God. What does Hebrews 8 say about this?
options: God will be their God, and they will be His people
The relationship will be distant and formal
The covenant only applies to religious officials
It removes the need to know God personally
questions.correctAnswer: God will be their God, and they will be His people
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:10 promises a personal relationship where God will be to them a God, and they shall be to Him a people, emphasizing intimacy and belonging.

questions.question: True or False: Hebrews 8 teaches that the first covenant was a perfect and lasting covenant with no need for replacement.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:7 clearly states that the first covenant was not faultless, which is why a second covenant was needed, demonstrating the imperfection of the old covenant.

questions.question: True or False: Hebrews 8 teaches that Jesus offers gifts and sacrifices as a high priest.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:3 states that every high priest is ordained to offer gifts and sacrifices; thus, Jesus as High Priest must have something to offer, signifying His sacrificial role.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Hebrews 8 teaches that God will put His laws into their ______, and write them in their ______.
options: minds; hearts
hands; feet
books; scrolls
temples; altars
questions.correctAnswer: minds; hearts
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:10 teaches that God's laws will be placed into the minds and written on the hearts of His people, indicating internal transformation.

hard.title: Hebrews Chapter 8 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Hebrews Chapter 8.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 8:1, where is the high priest set?
options: On the right hand of the throne of the Majesty in the heavens
At the entrance of the earthly tabernacle
In the holy of holies on earth
Beside the Ark of the Covenant in the temple
questions.correctAnswer: On the right hand of the throne of the Majesty in the heavens
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:1 states that the high priest is set on the right hand of the throne of the Majesty in the heavens, emphasizing his heavenly and exalted position.

questions.question: Hebrews 8:2 describes the tabernacle where the high priest ministers. What is the distinguishing feature of this tabernacle?
options: It is the true tabernacle, pitched by the Lord, not by man
It is made of gold and precious stones
It is the earthly tabernacle built by Moses
It is a temporary structure in the wilderness
questions.correctAnswer: It is the true tabernacle, pitched by the Lord, not by man
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:2 emphasizes that the tabernacle where Jesus ministers is the true tabernacle, fashioned by God Himself, contrasting with the earthly tabernacle made by human hands.

questions.question: What is the primary role of every high priest according to Hebrews 8:3?
options: To offer gifts and sacrifices
To lead the people in worship songs
To interpret the law publicly
To govern the Israelite tribes
questions.correctAnswer: To offer gifts and sacrifices
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:3 states that every high priest is ordained to offer gifts and sacrifices, highlighting the priestly duty of mediation through offerings.

questions.question: Hebrews 8:4 explains why Jesus could not be an earthly priest. What reason does it give?
options: Because there are priests who offer gifts according to the law on earth
Because He was not from the tribe of Levi
Because He was not a descendant of Aaron
Because He was a prophet, not a priest
questions.correctAnswer: Because there are priests who offer gifts according to the law on earth
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:4 clarifies that Jesus is not a priest on earth since there are already priests offering gifts according to the Mosaic law, implying His priesthood is heavenly and superior.

questions.question: In Hebrews 8:5, the earthly tabernacle and priesthood are described as:
options: An example and shadow of heavenly things
The perfect and final sanctuary
A symbol of Egyptian worship
An obsolete form with no meaning
questions.correctAnswer: An example and shadow of heavenly things
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:5 describes the earthly tabernacle and priestly service as a pattern or shadow of the heavenly realities, indicating typology between earthly and heavenly worship.

questions.question: What does Hebrews 8:6 say about the ministry Jesus has obtained?
options: It is a more excellent ministry and the mediation of a better covenant
It is the same as the Levitical priesthood
It is limited to the people of Israel
It is based solely on earthly promises
questions.correctAnswer: It is a more excellent ministry and the mediation of a better covenant
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:6 highlights that Jesus has obtained a superior ministry, acting as mediator of a better covenant established on better promises.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 8:7, why was a second covenant necessary?
options: Because the first covenant had faults
Because the people demanded a new law
Because the temple was destroyed
Because Moses requested a new covenant
questions.correctAnswer: Because the first covenant had faults
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:7 explains that the first covenant was not faultless, necessitating the establishment of a second covenant.

questions.question: Hebrews 8:8 quotes the Lord saying He will make a new covenant with which groups?
options: The house of Israel and the house of Judah
The tribes of Ephraim and Manasseh
The Gentiles and the Jews
The Levites and the priests
questions.correctAnswer: The house of Israel and the house of Judah
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:8 quotes Jeremiah 31:31, indicating the new covenant is made with both the house of Israel and the house of Judah.

questions.question: The new covenant described in Hebrews 8:10 involves what key change regarding God's laws?
options: The laws will be put into their minds and written on their hearts
The laws will be abolished and replaced by grace
The laws will be inscribed on tablets of stone again
The laws will be orally taught by priests only
questions.correctAnswer: The laws will be put into their minds and written on their hearts
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:10 emphasizes the internalization of God's laws in the new covenant, signifying a transformation of the heart and mind.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from Hebrews 8:11: 'And they shall not teach every man his neighbour, and every man his brother, saying, Know the Lord: for ______.'
options: all shall know me, from the least to the greatest
the priests will instruct them daily
the law will be forgotten
the covenant will be written on stones
questions.correctAnswer: all shall know me, from the least to the greatest
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:11 states that under the new covenant, everyone will know the Lord personally, removing the need for individual teaching.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 8:12, what will God do regarding their sins and iniquities?
options: He will be merciful and remember their sins no more
He will punish them severely
He will record their sins for judgment
He will forgive only some of their sins
questions.correctAnswer: He will be merciful and remember their sins no more
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:12 promises mercy and complete forgiveness, indicating that God will no longer remember their sins and iniquities.

questions.question: What does Hebrews 8:13 say about the first covenant?
options: It is made old and ready to vanish away
It remains forever unchangeable
It is more glorious than the new covenant
It is the foundation of all covenants
questions.correctAnswer: It is made old and ready to vanish away
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:13 explains that by declaring a new covenant, the first covenant is considered obsolete and ready to disappear.

questions.question: True or False: Hebrews 8:5 suggests that Moses received divine instructions on how to build the earthly tabernacle as a pattern of heavenly things.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:5 states that Moses was admonished by God to make the tabernacle according to the pattern shown on the mountain, confirming the heavenly pattern.

questions.question: Hebrews 8:6 introduces Jesus as mediator of a better covenant. This better covenant is based on:
options: Better promises
Greater sacrifices
Laws written on stone
Earthly rituals
questions.correctAnswer: Better promises
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:6 states that the better covenant mediated by Jesus is founded on better promises than the old covenant.

questions.question: Which Old Testament prophet is quoted in Hebrews 8 to support the promise of a new covenant?
options: Jeremiah
Isaiah
Ezekiel
Daniel
questions.correctAnswer: Jeremiah
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:8-12 quotes Jeremiah 31:31-34, where the Lord promises a new covenant with Israel and Judah.

theological.title: Hebrews Chapter 8 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Hebrews Chapter 8 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 8:1, where is the high priest set?
options: At the right hand of the throne of the Majesty in the heavens
In the earthly tabernacle
In the temple of Jerusalem
Among the people of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: At the right hand of the throne of the Majesty in the heavens
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:1 states that the high priest is set at the right hand of the throne of the Majesty in the heavens, emphasizing Christ's heavenly priesthood and divine authority, consistent with Psalm 110:1 and Mark 16:19.

questions.question: What kind of tabernacle does the high priest minister to according to Hebrews 8:2?
options: The true tabernacle, which the Lord pitched
The earthly tabernacle made by man
The tabernacle made by Moses
The tabernacle of stone
questions.correctAnswer: The true tabernacle, which the Lord pitched
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:2 describes the high priest as ministering in the true tabernacle which God, not man, established, highlighting the eternal and divine nature of Christ’s priesthood, in contrast with the earthly tabernacle in Exodus 25:8-9 and John 1:14.

questions.question: Why must the high priest have something to offer, as stated in Hebrews 8:3?
options: Because every high priest is ordained to offer gifts and sacrifices
Because he must teach the law
Because he must lead the people in worship
Because he must build the tabernacle
questions.correctAnswer: Because every high priest is ordained to offer gifts and sacrifices
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:3 explains that every high priest must offer gifts and sacrifices, demonstrating the necessity of Christ offering Himself as a perfect sacrifice, fulfilling Leviticus 16:15-16 and Hebrews 7:27.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 8:4, why would the high priest not be a priest if he were on earth?
options: Because there are priests who offer gifts according to the law
Because he would be unworthy
Because he would not be able to enter the sanctuary
Because he would be a prophet instead
questions.correctAnswer: Because there are priests who offer gifts according to the law
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:4 states that if Christ were on earth, He would not be a priest because earthly priests offer gifts according to the law, whereas He ministers in a heavenly sanctuary, aligning with Leviticus 16 and Psalm 110:4.

questions.question: What serves as the example and shadow of heavenly things, as described in Hebrews 8:5?
options: The earthly tabernacle made by Moses
The temple in Jerusalem
The covenant with Abraham
The Ark of the Covenant
questions.correctAnswer: The earthly tabernacle made by Moses
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:5 explains that the earthly tabernacle is a pattern and shadow of heavenly realities, as God instructed Moses to build it according to the pattern seen on the mountain (Exodus 25:40, 26:30), showing the foreshadowing of Christ’s ministry.

questions.question: What kind of ministry has Christ obtained according to Hebrews 8:6?
options: A more excellent ministry as mediator of a better covenant
A temporary ministry until the law is fulfilled
A ministry of angels
A lesser ministry than the old covenant priests
questions.correctAnswer: A more excellent ministry as mediator of a better covenant
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:6 states Christ has obtained a more excellent ministry as mediator of a better covenant with better promises, fulfilling Jeremiah 31:31-34 and establishing the new covenant prophesied in the Old Testament.

questions.question: Why was there a need for a second covenant, according to Hebrews 8:7?
options: Because the first covenant was not faultless
Because the first covenant was too strict
Because the people did not understand the first covenant
Because the priests were corrupt
questions.correctAnswer: Because the first covenant was not faultless
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:7 explains that if the first covenant had been perfect, there would be no need for a second, indicating human failure under the Mosaic covenant and God's provision of a superior covenant, consistent with Galatians 3:10-13 and 2 Corinthians 3:7-11.

questions.question: Who does the new covenant in Hebrews 8:8 specifically address?
options: The house of Israel and the house of Judah
All nations
The Gentiles
The priests and Levites
questions.correctAnswer: The house of Israel and the house of Judah
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:8 cites the Lord speaking of a new covenant with the house of Israel and Judah, fulfilling Jeremiah 31:31-34 and demonstrating God's faithfulness to His chosen people through Christ.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 8:9, why was the first covenant not continued?
options: Because they did not continue in God's covenant
Because the covenant was lost
Because the covenant was too harsh
Because the law was incomplete
questions.correctAnswer: Because they did not continue in God's covenant
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:9 explains God’s regard for Israel faded because they did not remain faithful to His covenant made during the Exodus, highlighting human unfaithfulness and the need for a new covenant (Exodus 19:5, Deuteronomy 28:15).

questions.question: What does God promise to do in the new covenant according to Hebrews 8:10?
options: Put His laws into their mind and write them in their hearts
Give them a new temple
Send angels to teach them
Make a covenant with all nations
questions.correctAnswer: Put His laws into their mind and write them in their hearts
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:10 states God will put His laws in the minds and hearts of His people, making them His own, fulfilling Jeremiah 31:33 and Ezekiel 36:26-27 about internal transformation through the Spirit.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 8:11, what will not be necessary under the new covenant?
options: Teaching every man his neighbor to know the Lord
Sacrifices for sin
Observing the Sabbath
Circumcision
questions.correctAnswer: Teaching every man his neighbor to know the Lord
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:11 says all will know the Lord from least to greatest, so no one will need to teach another to know God personally, reflecting the intimate relationship promised in Jeremiah 31:34 and John 14:20.

questions.question: What does Hebrews 8:12 say God will do regarding their sins and iniquities?
options: Remember them no more
Punish them severely
Write them on tablets of stone
Make them an example
questions.correctAnswer: Remember them no more
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:12 promises God will be merciful and will no longer remember their sins and iniquities, emphasizing the forgiveness accomplished by Christ, consistent with Isaiah 43:25 and Micah 7:19.

questions.question: What happens to the first covenant according to Hebrews 8:13?
options: It becomes old and ready to vanish away
It is strengthened forever
It is renewed annually
It is written again on stone tablets
questions.correctAnswer: It becomes old and ready to vanish away
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:13 explains that by declaring a new covenant, the first becomes obsolete and is ready to disappear, illustrating the transition from Old Testament law to New Testament grace, as also taught in 2 Corinthians 3:11-14.

questions.question: What role does Christ serve in the new covenant according to Hebrews 8:6?
options: Mediator
Prophet
King
High priest on earth
questions.correctAnswer: Mediator
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:6 identifies Christ as the mediator of a better covenant, highlighting His unique role in reconciling God and humanity, consistent with 1 Timothy 2:5 and Romans 5:1-2.

questions.question: What is the basis for the better covenant mentioned in Hebrews 8:6?
options: Better promises
Greater sacrifices
Larger temple
More strict laws
questions.correctAnswer: Better promises
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:6 states the new covenant is established on better promises, emphasizing the superiority of God’s grace and eternal blessings in Christ, aligned with 2 Corinthians 1:20 and Psalm 89:34.
